entry.title: Cool Hover Effects That Use CSS Text Shadow
entry.summary: In my last article we saw how CSS background properties allow us to create cool hover effects. This time, we will focus on the CSS text-shadow property to explore even more interesting hovers. entry.title: COLRv1 and CSS font-palette: Web Typography Gets Colorful
entry.summary: According to Toshi Omagari, the author of Arcade Game Typography, the worldâ€™s first multi-colored digital font was created in 1982 for a never-released video game called Insector. Multi-colored fonts, sometimes called chromatic type, are still relatively rare on the â€¦ COLRv1 and CSS font-palette: Web Typography Gets Colorful originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.

entry.title: Letâ€™s Create a Tiny Programming Language
entry.summary: By now, you are probably familiar with one or more programming languages. But have you ever wondered how you could create your own programming language? And by that, I mean: A programming language is any set of rules that convert â€¦ Letâ€™s Create a Tiny Programming Language originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.

entry.title: Useful Tools for Creating AVIF Images
entry.summary: AVIF (AV1 Image File Format) is a modern image file format specification for storing images that offer a much more significant file reduction when compared to other formats like JPG, JPEG, PNG, and WebP. Version 1.0.0 of the AVIF specification â€¦ Useful Tools for Creating AVIF Images originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.

entry.title: How to Serve a Subdomain as a Subdirectory
entry.summary: Letâ€™s say you have a website built on a platform that excels at design and itâ€™s available at example.com. But that platform falls short at blogging. So you think to yourself, â€œWhat if I could use a different blogging â€¦ How to Serve a Subdomain as a Subdirectory originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.

entry.title: Syntax Highlighting (and More!) With Prism on a Static Site
entry.summary: So, youâ€™ve decided to build a blog with Next.js. Like any dev blogger, youâ€™d like to have code snippets in your posts that are formatted nicely with syntax highlighting. Perhaps you also want to display line numbers in the â€¦ Syntax Highlighting (and More!) With Prism on a Static Site originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.

entry.title: Adding Custom GitHub Badges to Your Repo
entry.summary: If youâ€™ve spent time looking at open-source repos onÂ GitHub, youâ€™ve probably noticed that most of them use badges in their README files.Â Take the official React repository,Â for instance.Â There are GitHub badges all over theÂ READMEÂ file thatÂ communicate important dynamic info,Â like the latest released â€¦ Adding Custom GitHub Badges to Your Repo originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.

entry.title: Creating Realistic Reflections With CSS
entry.summary: In design, reflections are stylized mirror images of objects. Even though they are not as popular as shadows, they have their moments â€” just think about the first time you explored the different font formats in MS Word or PowerPoint: â€¦ Creating Realistic Reflections With CSS originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.
